comments.body: Could you make a note here that `NaN`s are filled to zero by default, and that if you don't want that you should fill  or drop the NaNs before plotting. (No need for an example with nans)
just noticed, the spaces in the three lines above (in `:meth: `...`` -> `:meth:`...``) causes this not to render well

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +713,717 @@(:meth:`ax.plot() <matplotlib.axes.Axes.plot>`,
:meth: `ax.bar() <matplotlib.axes.Axes.bar>`,
:meth: `ax.scatter() <matplotlib.axes.Axes.scatter>`). These can be used
to control additional styling, beyond what pandas provides.
